Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on Searching the Bible
Menu.Message: The menu that you are viewing allows you to choose if you want to search the entire Bible (note: you may get lots of results), a testament, or just one book. If you know the verse is in a particular book it's best to choose to only search this book. If you know it's in a particular Testament e.g. the New Testament, then search only that testament. You are more likely to find the verse this way.

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on Searching the Bible
Menu.Message:
The search option allows you to search for a verse.
It's important to realise that this is not a topical search, or a phrase search. It's a word search. So for example if you enter 3 words, it will search the entire Bible for a verse that contains all the 3 words. A verse will be found only if it contains all of the words searched for.
Hint: leave out words such as "and", "if", "the" etc. and use words that will identify your verse. For example if you wanted to search for John 3:16, the search phrase "God loved" would find it. The search will find a maximum of 15 verses, if the verse you looking for is not there try changing your search words.
Remember, that it will only search the current translation that you are using. Different translations use different words which convey the same meaning. This means that a certain group of search words may find a verse in one translation but not another...

Menu.Title: About
Menu.Message:
This is a free MXit app. Many times you receive a reference to a Bible verse, but cant check what it is. With this app you have a quick way of finding a verse right here on MXit.
Please note that this is a Beta Version. It is still in the testing phase so some things might not be fully complete yet. If you notice anything strange, please let us know via the FeedBack option and we will look into it asap.

MxitApp.Menu:
Help on Verse Select You can access this option from the Main Menu of the App. This option allows you to enter a verse quickly by entering the verse key. e.g John 3:16 (you can use the short code for the book name as well e.g. John can be entered as Jn). If you want to see a whole section then you can enter the ending verse too. e.g. Ephesians 2:1-10. You can also let it span chapters e.g. Romans 7:21-8:4. Unfortunately you can only request a maximum of 30 verses at a time. Finally if you only know the book, you can just enter the name of the book and you will be shown the first verse of the first chapter in that book.
To see a list of all the short codes you can use, follow the link below. Help on using Short Codes to find a verse

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on the Browse Bible Option
Menu.Message: You can access this option from the Main Menu of the App. Choosing this option will take you through a series of menu options to allow you to choose the Testament, the name of the Book and the Chapter of the Scripture that you would like to see. Once you have chose then chapter it will direct you to the reading page and show you the first 5 verses of the chosen chapter.

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on the Reading Page
Menu.Message: The reading page is used to read a verse or multpile verses at a time. Depending on how you arrived at the reading page you may be shown one verse or a few verses (up to a maximum of 30 verses at a time). From this page you can then request to see more verses by choosing the "more" option. The "more" option will show you 5 more verses after the current verse. You can also choose to see either the previous or next chapter if there is one. Choosing to see either the previous or next chapter will take you to the first verse of that chapter. If you are currently viewing a verse you can also jump straight to another verse by entering the verse number e.g. "5". Entering "5" will show you verse 5 if you want to see verse 5 in the same chapter. You can also jump to a different chapter by entering the chapter and verse. e.g. if you currently viewing John 1:1, entering "3:16" will take you to John 3:16. Finally you can jump to any book by just entering the new key. So if you reading John 3:16, you can enter "Rev 3:20" to go directly to the new verse from the reading page without having to go back to the verse select or the browse menu's. All the input methods that apply for the Verse Select page applies to the reading page. So for example you can also enter an ending verse like "Eph 2:1-10" without having to go back to the Verse Select page to request this

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on choosing a translation
Menu.Message:
The Choose a Translation page allows you to change the translation of the Bible that you are viewing in the current session.
By default the World English Bible Translation is chosen. However this may be changed by choosing a different translation. At the moment the following two translations are available (Information is from Wikipedia :) ):
King James Version - The Authorized Version, commonly known as the King James Version, King James Bible or KJV, is an English translation by the Church of England of the Christian Bible begun in 1604 and completed in 1611.
World English Bible - The World English Bible, also known as the WEB Version, is a public domain translation of the Bible that is currently in draft form. Work on the World English Bible began in 1997 and was known as the American Standard Version 1997. The New Testament is considered complete and is available in print.
New English Translation - The New English Translation (NET Bible) is a free, "completely new"(not an update of another English translation) on-line English translation of the Bible, sponsored by the Biblical Studies Foundation and published by Biblical Studies Press.

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on the Verse History Option
Menu.Message:
This option allows you to see a list of up to 15 verses that you have requested previously.
Any verse that you previously requested on the BibleApp will show up on this list allowing you to easily locate it again. However the history will last for a minimum of 1 month, after that time period it might be cleared. Verses will not be saved when you are browsing in 'The Reading Page' and press the "More", "Next Chapter" or "Previous Chapter" options. Only the original request would be recorded. Duplicate verses may be stored in the history list as well.

Menu.name: Help
Menu.Title: Help on the My Favourite Verses
Menu.Message:
This option allows you to see a list of up to 15 verses that you have saved previously as your favourites.
You can save up to a maximum of 15 favourites (verse or sections i.e. you can save Eph 2:1-10 and this will count as one favourite).
Once you reach the limit you will have to delete an existing favourite to make some more space to store a new favourite. To delete one click on the 'x' next to the entry, or send the following text "del:" followed by the index you want to delete.
